title: Morpho theseus
text:
Morpho theseus, the Theseus morpho, is a <a href="Neotropical">Neotropical</a> butterfly. It is found in <a href="Panama">Panama</a>, <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, <a href="Peru">Peru</a>, <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>, <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>, <a href="Honduras">Honduras</a> and <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>.
Description.
In 1913, <a href="Hans%20Fruhstorfer">Hans Fruhstorfer</a> wrote:
""Morpho theseus" apparently replaces "<a href="Morpho%20hercules">hercules</a>" in Central America and the Andean region. It is less constant than "hercules", inclining to geographical and probably also to climatic variation, has somewhat narrower wings than "hercules" and is distinguished from all other Morphids by the long, pointed teeth of the hindwing." 
Note: "<a href="Morpho%20amphitryon">Morpho amphitryon</a>", which was considered a race of "Morpho theseus" by Fruhstorfer, also has the "pointed teeth" or scalloping.
Ground colour brown inclining to olive green, base only quite faintly suffused with whitish. Cell black brown at the extremity and with an inconspicuous whitish spot before the apex. Forewing with only two distinct rows of yellowish patches.
Many <a href="subspecies">subspecies</a> have been described.
Etymology.
<a href="Theseus">Theseus</a> was a legendary king of Athens.
